title: Modern pentathlon at the 2004 Summer Olympics – Men's
text:
The men's <a href="modern%20pentathlon">modern pentathlon</a> at the <a href="2004%20Summer%20Olympics">2004 Summer Olympics</a> took place at the <a href="Olympic%20Modern%20Pentathlon%20Centre%20%28Athens%29">Olympic Modern Pentathlon Centre</a> in <a href="Goudi%20Olympic%20Complex">Goudi Olympic Complex</a> on 26 August. Thirty-two athletes from 20 nations participated in this event.
Although the event was considered wide open, as no other athlete dominated the sport since <a href="2000%20Summer%20Olympics">2000</a>, the Russians, Lithuanians and Czechs continued to reach the top positions in the men's competition. Russia's <a href="Andrey%20Moiseev">Andrey Moiseev</a> won the gold medal with a score of 5,480 points. <a href="Andrejus%20Zadneprovskis">Andrejus Zadneprovskis</a> of Lithuania won the nation's first ever Olympic medal in modern pentathlon, taking the silver. <a href="Libor%20Capalini">Libor Capalini</a> of the Czech Republic, on the other hand, claimed the bronze, winning his nation's first medal in the sport since <a href="Jan%20B%C3%A1rt%C5%AF">Jan Bártů</a> in <a href="1976%20Summer%20Olympics">1976</a>.
Competition format.
The modern pentathlon consisted of five events, with all five held in one day.
